channel.title: Asianüåè on Loving my tummy
channel.description: Recent content in Asianüåè on Loving my tummy

item.title: Banana ice cream
item.description: Blend the bananas with the yogurt and peanut butter in a blender. Place in the freezer for 30 minutes. Serve and add the chopped chocolate pieces. Adaptation from Instagram @miguelnaarfit.

item.title: Char Siu (Chinese BBQ pork)
item.description: Prepare the Pork: Cut the pork into long strips or chunks, each about 5 to 7.5 cm thick. Avoid trimming the fat as it helps keep the pork juicy and flavorful during cooking. Make the Marinade: In a bowl, combine sugar, salt, five-spice powder, white pepper, sesame oil, Shaoxing wine, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, molasses (or dark soy), garlic, and food coloring (if using). For an extra layer of flavor, add 1 teaspoon of oyster sauce.

item.title: Chicken kebab
item.description: In a bowl, mix all the ingredients (except the pineapple) with the chicken. Let it marinate for 1 hour. Skewer the chicken onto a wooden stick. Place a layer of pineapple on a baking tray and place the skewer on top of it. Bake at 200¬∞C (390¬∞F) for 60-90 minutes, turning it halfway through. Scile into the chicken. Serve the chicken in pita bread or on a plate with your favourite sides.

item.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
item.description: Cook the rice. Cut the chicken breast into pieces and saut√© with salt and pepper. Add the cream cheese, Greek yogurt, and a bit of tomato paste, and mix well. Add sweet or spicy paprika, garlic and onion powder, a generous amount of curry, a pinch of cumin, and food coloring (optional). Mix until it reduces slightly. From Instagram @ugar90.

item.title: Gohan (Japanese rice)
item.description: Use round or bomba rice (avoid basmati or long-grain rice). Measure the rice and place it in a pot. Add plenty of water to the pot, stir quickly 2 or 3 times, and then discard the water. Add water again and wash the rice by hand, repeating this process 3-6 times (or until the water runs clear), and discarding the water each time. Add an equal amount of water to the washed rice, cover with a lid, and if you have time, I recommend letting the rice soak for 30 minutes.

item.title: Homemade Sushi
item.description: Tip: The best rice for making sushi is the Japonica variety, which is short-grain and sticky, and can be found in all Asian stores and many supermarkets. If you don’t have time to buy it, you can also use Bomba rice, which has similar characteristics. Cook the rice and refrigerate it in the fridge. Cover an egg carton with plastic wrap. Place small pieces of salmon in each compartment. Add avocado on top and the cream cheese (optional).

item.title: Oat and Chocolate cookies
item.description: You can use wheat flour or any other kind of flour. I even recommend using ground oats as flour, in addition to the oat flakes. Preheat the oven with two baking trays lined with parchment paper. Mix the butter, sugar, and egg in a bowl. Add the remaining ingredients to the mixture except for the chocolate, and mix with a dough utensil until fully combined. Add the chopped chocolate and incorporate it evenly into the dough.

item.title: Yukihira style shalyapin steak don
item.description: To prepare the rice bowl, follow the Gohan receipt. How to cook Chop the onions finely. (Optional) Chop the garlic and mix with the onion. Remove the tendons from the beef and beat it with a meat tenderizer until as flat as possible. Cover meat on both sides with the chopped onion and leave for 30 minutes or more. Remove the onion and add salt and pepper to the steak. the onion until it changes color.
